goal.tools.debugger

Enum Channel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<Channel>
      • goal.tools.debugger.Channel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Channel>

    public enum Channel
extends java.lang.Enum<Channel>
    Represents different event channels to which debug observers can subscribe.
    Author:
    KH, N.Kraayenbrink Rearranged 10apr2011

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Channel.ChannelState
      The state of a Channel.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      ACTION_EXECUTED_BUILTIN
      Channel for reports on built-in actions that have been executed.
      ACTION_EXECUTED_USERSPEC
      Channel for reports on user-spec actions that have been executed.
      ACTION_PRECOND_EVALUATION
      Channel for reports on actions going to be executed.
      ACTION_PRECOND_EVALUATION_USERSPEC
      Channel for reports on user-spec actions going to be executed.
      ACTIONCOMBO_FINISHED
      Channel for reports on complete actioncombos that have been executed.
      ATOM_QUERIES
      Channel for reports on queries by atoms.
      BB_UPDATES
      Channel for reports on additions to / deletions from the belief base.
      BREAKPOINTS
      Special channel for notifying the debugger for user-defined breakpoints.
      CALL_MODULE
      Channel for reporting the call (before-entry) of any module.
      EVENT_MODULE_ENTRY
      Channel for reporting on the entry of the event module.
      EVENT_MODULE_EXIT
      Channel for reporting on the exit of the event module.
      GB_CHANGES
      Channel for reports on any changes to the goal base.
      GB_UPDATES
      Channel for reports on additions to / deletions from the goal base.
      GOAL_ACHIEVED
      Channel for reports on goals that have been achieved (and not dropped).
      HIDDEN_RULE_CONDITION_EVALUATION
      Channel for reporting on the evaluation of a rule's condition.
      INIT_MODULE_ENTRY
      Channel for reporting on the entry of the init module.
      INIT_MODULE_EXIT
      Channel for reporting on the exit of the init module.
      MAILS
      Channel for reports on received mails.
      MAILS_CONDITIONAL_VIEW
      Channel for reporting percepts inserted into percept base, but only if PERCEPTS channel has VIEW state.
      MAIN_MODULE_ENTRY
      Channel for reporting on the entry of the main module.
      MAIN_MODULE_EXIT
      Channel for reporting on the exit of the main module.
      MIDDLEWARE_AGENT
      Middleware reports here.
      PERCEPTS
      Channel for reports on received percepts.
      PERCEPTS_CONDITIONAL_VIEW
      Channel for reporting percepts inserted into percept base, but only if PERCEPTS channel has VIEW state.
      REASONING_CYCLE_SEPARATOR
      Special channel for the separator between reasoning cycles.
      RULE_APPLICATION_SUMMARY
      Reports whether rule is applicable, and, if so, for which instantiations if has been applied.
      RULE_CONDITION_EVALUATION
      Channel for reporting on the evaluation of a rule's condition.
      RULE_CONDITIONAL_VIEW
      Channel for reporting that a rule is being evaluated
      RUNMODE
      Channel to report on changes in run mode.
      SLEEP
      Channel to report that agent has gone to sleep.
      USER_MODULE_ENTRY
      Channel for reporting the entry of a user-defined module.
      USER_MODULE_EXIT
      Channel for reporting the exit of a user-defined module.

        Special channel for the separator between reasoning cycles.

        Channel for reports on received mails.

        Channel for reports on received percepts.

      • PERCEPTS_CONDITIONAL_VIEW

        public static final Channel PERCEPTS_CONDITIONAL_VIEW
        Channel for reporting percepts inserted into percept base, but only if PERCEPTS channel has VIEW state.

      • INIT_MODULE_ENTRY

        public static final Channel INIT_MODULE_ENTRY
        Channel for reporting on the entry of the init module.

      • MAIN_MODULE_ENTRY

        public static final Channel MAIN_MODULE_ENTRY
        Channel for reporting on the entry of the main module.

        public static final Channel EVENT_MODULE_ENTRY
        Channel for reporting on the entry of the event module.

        Channel for reporting the entry of a user-defined module.

        Channel for reporting on the exit of the init module.

        public static final Channel MAIN_MODULE_EXIT
        Channel for reporting on the exit of the main module.

      • EVENT_MODULE_EXIT

        public static final Channel EVENT_MODULE_EXIT
        Channel for reporting on the exit of the event module.

      • USER_MODULE_EXIT

        public static final Channel USER_MODULE_EXIT
        Channel for reporting the exit of a user-defined module.

      • CALL_MODULE

        public static final Channel CALL_MODULE
        Channel for reporting the call (before-entry) of any module.

      • RULE_APPLICATION_SUMMARY

        public static final Channel RULE_APPLICATION_SUMMARY
        Reports whether rule is applicable, and, if so, for which instantiations if has been applied.

      • RULE_CONDITION_EVALUATION

        public static final Channel RULE_CONDITION_EVALUATION
        Channel for reporting on the evaluation of a rule's condition.

      • HIDDEN_RULE_CONDITION_EVALUATION

        public static final Channel HIDDEN_RULE_CONDITION_EVALUATION
        Channel for reporting on the evaluation of a rule's condition. Passes a different object, used for conditional breakpoints!

      • RULE_CONDITIONAL_VIEW

        public static final Channel RULE_CONDITIONAL_VIEW
        Channel for reporting that a rule is being evaluated

      • ACTION_PRECOND_EVALUATION

        public static final Channel ACTION_PRECOND_EVALUATION
        Channel for reports on actions going to be executed.

      • ACTION_PRECOND_EVALUATION_USERSPEC

        public static final Channel ACTION_PRECOND_EVALUATION_USERSPEC
        Channel for reports on user-spec actions going to be executed. Only actions with a precondition should report here.

      • ACTION_EXECUTED_BUILTIN

        public static final Channel ACTION_EXECUTED_BUILTIN
        Channel for reports on built-in actions that have been executed.

      • ACTION_EXECUTED_USERSPEC

        public static final Channel ACTION_EXECUTED_USERSPEC
        Channel for reports on user-spec actions that have been executed.

      • ACTIONCOMBO_FINISHED

        public static final Channel ACTIONCOMBO_FINISHED
        Channel for reports on complete actioncombos that have been executed.

      • BB_UPDATES

        public static final Channel BB_UPDATES
        Channel for reports on additions to / deletions from the belief base.

      • GB_UPDATES

        public static final Channel GB_UPDATES
        Channel for reports on additions to / deletions from the goal base.

      • GB_CHANGES

        public static final Channel GB_CHANGES
        Channel for reports on any changes to the goal base. This is a channel similar to GB_UPDATES but hidden.

      • GOAL_ACHIEVED

        public static final Channel GOAL_ACHIEVED
        Channel for reports on goals that have been achieved (and not dropped).

      • ATOM_QUERIES

        public static final Channel ATOM_QUERIES
        Channel for reports on queries by atoms. Reports should contain both the query and the result. a-goal and goal-a should not be separated into smaller atoms.

      • MIDDLEWARE_AGENT

        public static final Channel MIDDLEWARE_AGENT
        Middleware reports here. For now we hide this.

      • RUNMODE

        public static final Channel RUNMODE
        Channel to report on changes in run mode. Internal use only.

      • SLEEP

        public static final Channel SLEEP
        Channel to report that agent has gone to sleep.

      • BREAKPOINTS

        public static final Channel BREAKPOINTS
        Special channel for notifying the debugger for user-defined breakpoints.
